commit.message:
[clang compat] Handle new cast kind for HLSL array temporaries

The new cast kind CK_HLSLArrayRValue was added in:
https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/commit/9434c083475e42f47383f3067fe2a155db5c6a30

I can't see that it would affect IWYU analysis, so just handle it
silently to placate -Wswitch.

Fix comment

No functional change.

Fix provision analysis with public headers

This fixes determination of types provided with type aliases and
function declarations (fn return, "autocast") in the presence of mapping
files. The problem was in that the `PublicHeaderIntendsToProvide`
function considers as provided all the headers transitively included
from a public header, despite they are may be themselves public and not
have the explicit public-to-public mapping specified. It is convenient
to avoid noisy suggestions of the library internals when handling
instantiations of some external library templates, but may hinder
expressing author intent when writing e.g. some own (user's) `typedef`
(non-)providing a type from such a library.

To achieve the more correct behavior, the logic from
`OneUse::SetPublicHeaders()` function has been reused which takes into
account only explicitly specified mappings. The drawback is that the use
site vs. the decl site difference for default template arguments becomes
worse (see `TestDefaultTplArgs()`). The use site handling still uses
`PublicHeaderIntendsToProvide` (which is common way for template
instantiation handling, as stated before). It may end up in that IWYU
may suggest to remove an indirectly providing header from the template
defining file (`-d1.h` from `-def_tpl_arg.h` in the test case)
not suggesting to `#include` the default argument header at the use site
because at the time of analysis `-d1.h` is present in `-def_tpl_arg.h`
and "provides" all its directly and indirectly included stuff. OTOH, it
may be fixed easily by means of including the appropriate header
in the template instantiating file manually, and the IWYU behavior
should become consistent.

The main goal of these changes is to introduce `IsDirectlyIncluded`
function which may be reused when fixing `UnresolvedLookupExpr`-related
bugs (`PublicHeaderIntendsToProvide` doesn't work well in real-world
cases for it).

Loosen Python version requirements for functools.cache

We started using functools.cache recently, and it's apparently new as of
Python 3.9. Give people some slack using a local alias for
functools.lru_cache, which has been around since Python 3.2.

[mappings] Reformat closing brackets in all .imp files

Minimal rewrite to remove space before closing bracket:

    -{ "include": ["<a.h>", "private", "<b.h>", "public" ] },
    +{ "include": ["<a.h>", "private", "<b.h>", "public"] },

This is the unadorned result of:

    find . -name "*.imp" -exec sed -Ei -e 's/" \]/"\]/g' {} \;

No functional change intended.
[doc] Update manpage for stricter mapping syntax

[doc] Update mapping docs

* Clarify YAML heritage
* Note explicitly which YAML vs. JSON extensions we use
* Quote all mapping directives in examples
* Describe --no_default_mappings

[mappings] Quote all private keywords in .imp files

This is the unadorned output of:

    sed -Ei -e 's/, private/, "private"/g' *.imp

No functional change intended.

[mappings] Quote all public keywords in .imp files

This is the unadorned output of:

    sed -Ei -e 's/, public/, "public"/g' *.imp

No functional change intended.

[mappings] Quote all symbol keywords in .imp files

This is the unadorned output of:

    sed -Ei -e "s/symbol: \[/\"symbol\": \[/g" *.imp

No functional change intended.

[mappings] Quote all include keywords in .imp files

This is the unadorned output of:

    sed -Ei -e "s/include: \[/\"include\": \[/g" *.imp

No functional change intended.

[mappings] Quote all ref keywords in iwyu.gcc..imp

Quote both keyword and filenames.

No functional change intended.

[mappings] Clean up comment format in .imp

* Single space after #
* Remove trailing comments, they were mostly noise
* Separate # for lines starting with '#include'
* Use consistent indentation for manually added mapping lines

No functional change intended.
[mappings] Clean trailing whitespace from *.imp

[mappings] Clean up libcxx mapping sed pipeline

Using single quotes in this pipeline removes the requirement for
escaping double quotes.

[mappings] Add symbol mapping for std::ptrdiff_t

std::ptrdiff_t should always come from <cstddef>.

Fixes issue #1478.

[mappings] Regenerate mappings for platform bits/ headers

Use a slightly tweaked pipeline that gets rid of bits/c++config.h.

bits/c++config.h is a config header used by a number of libstdc++
headers. It contains internal config macros for libstdc++, but also
architecture-specific definitions of std::size_t and std::ptrdiff_t.

There is no way to map bits/c++config.h to a single public header;
rather we should rely on symbol mappings for the few public symbols
which happen to live here.

Move libstdc++ debug/ headers to separate map/file

The other libstdc++ mappings are mostly generated by a shell pipeline
and it makes it harder to refresh them if we have a block of
hand-maintained debug/ headers in the middle.

Fix handling function references

Additional filtering of function references has been removed. It is not
needed now because reporting of return type is avoided.

This fixes reporting of template argument type when the template has no
definition in the translation unit but the full type info is needed
to build the instantiated function prototype, as well as handling
instantiations of regular member functions of class templates. It was
a regression introduced in #1300.

`nodes_to_ignore_` restored after function traversal so as to avoid
short-circuiting inside `IwyuBaseAstVisitor::HandleFunctionCall` which
could occur because function declaration was already traversed on its
`DeclRefExpr` handling.

Decouple handling of fn references from fn calls

Function references differ from calls in that the return type should not
be reported in the former case. It was achieved by means of (not fully)
complemetary `if`-conditions inside `TraverseDeclRefExpr` and
`IwyuBaseAstVisitor::HandleFunctionCall` functions stating that fn refs
should be analyzed only for instantiated template functions with
definitions, meanwhile return types should be reported in the opposite
case. But it is not fully correct. In fact, the full return type info is
required on any function call. It is just convenient to report it on
instantiated template visitation because the type may be provided by
some `typedef`-ed template argument. But it stops working e.g. when
the function template has no definition in the translation unit, just
a declaration. This change enables separate improvement of function
reference and function call handling.

No functional change is intended.

Remove redundant debug/safe_iterator.tcc mapping

I added complete mappings for debug/ GCC headers in
abc3aeefa0af810e4ec00a2c14bae538568dd8c8, but I failed to notice that
debug/safe_local_iterator.tcc was already mapped.

That leads to an assertion failure for conflicting visibilities for:

    include-what-you-use \
        -Xiwyu --no_default_mappings \
        -Xiwyu --mapping_file=gcc.stl.headers.imp \
        ...

Remove the old mapping, it's superseded by the new.
also add uses_allocator
add memory_resource to gcc stl imp file

Remove unused parameters

No functional change.

Isolate platform specific headers to a translation unit

Including Windows related headers in iwyu_port.h pollutes other
translation units with Windows-specific definitions.  Move the function
GlobMatchesPath to have external linkage instead of being inline and
move the platform-specific code to a new file iwyu_port.cc

Fixes #1485

Fix LLVM_DEFINITIONS usage

 LLVM_DEFINITIONS should have been passed to MSVC as a list, instead it was taken as a single string. The correct way can be seen at "Embedding LLVM in your project ", llvm.org/docs/CMake.html

Consider variable definitions uses of extern declarations

For every variable definition, traverse all preceding declarations and
record uses of ones with external storage (which is potentially all of
them, I don't think non-extern redeclarations are allowed).

Use the same mechanics as for non-member functions to mark them up as
definition-uses.

Fixes #1461.

Simplify non-member function definition handling

Function definitions can only be reported from VisitFunctionDecl, so
there's no need to search the AST for every use report in
ComputeUseFlags.

(The same is not true for IsNodeInsideCXXMethodBody; that will actually
be true for arbitrarily deep subtrees.)

Instead, pass the use-flag explicitly in VisitFunctionDecl when
reporting declarations.

While here, clarify a comment and make more const-correct.

Generalize UF_FunctionDfn

UF_FunctionDfn is currently only used for functions, but the same kind
of rules could be applied for other exported symbols.

Rename to UF_DefinitionUse, and try to generalize/clarify the wording in
some comments.

No functional change.

Use "non-member" instead of "free" consistently

The C++ standard uses "non-member functions" consistently (and even has
some revisions only changing from "free function" to "non-member
function").

Follow terminology in IWYU.

No functional change.
